boardgame.name: The Reckoners: Steelslayer
boardgame.description:
David Charleston, now known as “Steelslayer,” and the rest of the Reckoners attempt to bring human governance back to Newcago and continue on their quest to liberate the oppressed peoples of the Fractured States. However, the Epics will not be so easily stopped. With new allies and challenges ahead, can you live up to the Steelslayer name?

The Reckoners: Steelslayer is an expansion to The Reckoners board game containing four new modules. These elements can be added separately or together in any combination.

Module 1: New Reckoners
Module 2: New Equipment
Module 3: New Epics
Module 4: New Boss Epics & Cities

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Yargonium
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Der gesunde Menschenverstand hat Vorrang vor jeder anderen Regel. Es sollte niemals im Spiel auf eine Regel bestanden werden, wenn die Logik sagt, daß es eigentlich Blödsinn ist. Kein Regelsystem ist perfekt.

User summary:

This basic rules for Yargonium were published online in HTML format.

boardgame.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 275 - 2020)
boardgame.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table
No. 275

2020

boardgame.name: The Zorro Dice Game: Stunts and Allies
boardgame.description:
This expansion to The Zorro Dice Game gives each player an Ally, who will level up throughout the game, providing your hero with special abilities and a subtle catch-up mechanic. If your Ally reaches its max level, you will unlock your own, personal Ally Die as well. But each Ally has a weakness that you have to mitigate as you fight Scoundrels and Villains, which increases the difficulty of the game overall.

Stunt Tokens were added as well, which offer additional opportunities for mid-turn tactics, like switching Heroic Feats or re-rolling dice.

Lastly, it will add more Equipment, Scoundrels, and Villains to the base game as well for additional replayability and more combos to try in your overall strategy.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Zorro Dice Game: Ally Pack #1
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Zorro Dice Game: Metal Ally Dice

boardgame.name: Vulture
boardgame.description:
Vulture is a build-em-up arcade shooter with a retro aesthetic. In Vulture, the player controls a drone provided by the local military as it engages various types of enemies who have invaded the planet. As the player progresses through 9 levels of intense combat, they will encounter increasingly larger and more powerful enemies. Players are ranked at the end of each level based on their score and number of enemies destroyed. High rankings give better rewards!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Inner System Blues
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Earth's a dump. Mars is a wasteland. Venus belongs to the elite. If you can't afford a ticket out of system, you gotta take gigs to survive today - and maybe fight for a better tomorrow.

boardgame.name: 2400: CTRL
ALT
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You can get anything in Alpha Centauri - even a new body. But with new worlds, plug-and-play memories, and no fear of death, strange new risks arise. That's where you come in. As CTRL agents, you're dispatched to deal with threats to the worlds. You'll get a new body if you die, but you'd better save up if you don't want whatever (or whoever) they've got lying around.

boardgame.name: Cosmic Highway
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You've got a ship. You've got a crew. Now you need the credits to keep 'em flying. Salvage, smuggle, shoot, or speed your way to your next payday. Come on - let's go space truckin'.

boardgame.name: Die WÃ¤lder von Carcassonne V2 (fan-erweiterung fÃ¼r Carcassonne)
boardgame.description:
The name already reveals it: In this expansion the forest is introduced as a new landscape feature. But Andreas was not satisfied with that, because e.g. with the avenues as new road maps, the pyre or the trees there are some more features.
The design of Andreas was not used for following expansions.

boardgame.name: Fearless Creatures: B is for Biome Pack
boardgame.description:
An 18 card set of biospheres that represent individual creatures, groups of creatures, creature capabilities. Some standalone, some interact with other creature cards, and some alter the status of the game.

Expands the base Fearless Creatures card game with more variety and adds an element of mystery.

boardgame.name: Danny Phantom
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the world of Danny Phantom. Well, technically it is two worlds; the human world and the Ghost Zone. The history of these two worlds are simple; humans fear and hate ghosts and ghosts hate humans. But this isn’t like normal worlds at war. This is a Nickelodeon show, so the fights are down played.

You arrive one month after a young Danny Fenton gained his ghost powers (episode one). He still doesn’t have full control of them, but he is learning. What you do in your ten years is now up to you.

boardgame.name: Skylanders Giants
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Greetings, Portal Master! I am Eon, and I have come to guide you on a great journey. Welcome to Skylands: a magical world of wonder and adventure, protected by the greatest heroes ever known – the Skylanders! It had long been my duty to watch over the Skylands, and lead them, but this task has been given to you. And now, you have found a Giant, which is why I have sought you out. Giants were the first Skylanders, from long ago, and they have not been seen in Skylands for a very long time. I believe you have found them for a reason. To better understand, let us look back. Back, 10,000 long years, to a time where Skylands was ruled by an evil empire of robots known as: the Arkeyans.


- Master Eon explains the history of the Giants to the Portal Master

boardgame.name: Clan War: Unicorn Army Expansion
boardgame.description:
Clan War: Unicorn Army Expansion is a source book containing all the information needed to play a Unicorn Clan army in Clan War

history,
units,
organization, and
tactics

boardgame.name: Nightmare Aventuras de Horror: Bienvenidos a la MansiÃ³n Crafton
Nightmare Das Thriller Spiel
Nightmare Horror Adventures: Welcome to Crafton Mansion
Nightmare Horror Story Adventures
Nightmare: Das Thriller Spiel
boardgame.description:
The scariest boardgame out there….based on the horror, storytelling & experience trend.

Solve the murders, prevent your own!
Growing up at Crafton Mansion, you and your cousins lived out easy childhoods. But one fateful night, everything changed when your parents were all burned alive. The horrible events had left you orphaned and so terribly traumatized that you are unable to remember anything that happened that night. Now, fifteen years later you and your cousins are reunited at Crafton Mansion by one of your cousins Johnny, but Johnny is nowhere to be found. All you find is a sinister message on the wall, written in blood: Welcome back....

—description from publisher (translated)

You were enjoying a carefree childhood with your cousins at Grafton Manor. But a fateful night changed everything: Your parents were locked up in the garden shed and burned alive. You don’t have any memories of what happened that night. 15 years later you meet up with your cousins again at Grafton Manor. In a letter, your oldest cousin Johnny asked for help to solve the murder case. However, when you arrived you couldn’t find him anywhere. You only find a message on the wall written with blood: Welcome back!
The Nightmare adventure thriller is guaranteed to send a chill through your bones! You’re on the search for the murderer who killed your parents. Find the perpetrator, otherwise you’ll be in trouble!
"Nightmare - The Thriller Game" is played with an app that guides you through the terrifying train of events. The game also comes with character and story cards that provide information and clues. When the power fails, you have to put a blindfold on and wait for instructions. Be prepared for nerve-wracking events that change everything!

A thrilling real-time game from the creators of Escape Room. The game is designed for 4-5 players aged 16 and above and takes approximately 2.5 hours to complete.

boardgame.name: The Shipwreck Arcana: The Restless Hours Promo Card
boardgame.description:
An alternate Hours card delivered with Atma RPG Kickstarter, with Atma-themed art and the variant Doom rules from the PnP on Shipwreck Arcana site.

Alternate rules for "doomed" difficulty.

Setup:
1. Shuffle the deck of arcana cards.
2. Remove all but 15 cards from the game.
3. Begin play as normal, but without the doom tracker.

Gameplay:
- Whenever doom would be accrued, instead remove that many cards from the bottom of the deck.
- When a faded power is used, remove it from the game instead of returning it to the bottom of the deck.

Winning/losing:
- Players win when they reach 7 points.
- Players lose if no deck remains when a card fades or doom is accrued.

listing.notes:
The Restless Hours is a single promo card for The Shipwreck Arcana that was released during the Atma: A Roleplaying Card Game Kickstarter in 2020. It replaces the regular Hours card and offers an alternative way to play, where the arcana deck itself serves as the doom track!
Not a standalone game. Requires The Shipwreck Arcana base game.
New! Unused Shipping and BGG Fees $4

boardgame.name: The Forest of Forgotten Dragons
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Our heroes take a contract leading them to a town plagued by disappearing cattle. Investigations will lead the party to a forest where defunct albino dragons are cared for by an excited hermit who has been driven dangerously close to town by an unknown force to the north. It seems a dragonborne cult has learned of this strange flock and seeks to cleanse these impure dragons to gain favor with the gods. Can our heroes save these forgotten dragons? Will they have the know-how or strength to overcome this fearsome cult?!

boardgame.name: The Capitals Game
boardgame.description:
The Capitals Game contains 193 Flash cards representing the recognized countries of the world (by the UN). Each card shows the flag on the back along with country details on the front.

What can you do on those long trips in the car? How can you help your kids learn more about the world?
The Capital Game allows a family to interact and learn more about the world around them.

There are unlimited ways you can play this game but the most popular are:
Who’s Flag is this?
What is the Capital of?
Guess the Country?
Biggest Wins
Countries (or capitals) by the Alphabet

The deck also comes with blank cards allowing you to hide the front (or back of the
cards) to keep other players guessing.
Each card has the flag on one side and some information about the country on the other:
Name
Capital City
Approx Population (2020)
Currency
GDP
Main Languages
Land Mass Size
Location on the globe

It also shows membership of:
G20
OECD
WTO
APEC
NATO
Commonwealth

boardgame.name: Army of the Damned
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Innistrad is a setting steeped in gothic horror themes and makes liberal use of horror tropes. Werewolves hunt within the forests, vengeful spirits haunt the places of their grisly deaths, hedonistic vampires feast on humans at their leisure, and Frankenstein-like mad scientists create abominations stitched together from corpses. All these classic horror stories are merged together to create a unified campaign setting that is much more than the sum of its parts, an amazing and compelling backdrop for epic storytelling.

boardgame.name: Nicholas the Gift-giver's Northern Palace
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the farthest northern reaches of icy darkness stands a fabulous palace—the grand home of a mysterious tribe of gift-giving elves. At least, rumors speak of such a place. Great riches and rewards supposedly emanate from the Northern Palace, so surely any party of adventurers will find it a worthy location to seek out.

The rumors are only partly true. While the so-called Northern Palace is indeed home to a famous gift-giver, its principal inhabitants are not elves—they’re gnomes, reindeer, and a couple of humans. The Northern Palace serves as the home and workshop of Nicholas the Gift-Giver and his helpers.

boardgame.name: Butterfly Effect
boardgame.description:
Butterfly Effect is the game of Unintended Consequences. A hilarious game where you put your mind to the test. Can you explain what happened? Use your quick wits and a healthy dose of the ridiculous. Fun for friends and family as you compete to see who can master the CHAOS.

How to play:
The Butterfly Effect (also known as Chaos Theory) came from an age old saying - A butterfly flaps its wings in China causing a Tornado in America. This is the idea that a small change can create far reaching ramifications somewhere else.
So how do you play?
It’s very easy to play. Each player gets handed out a series of cards:
A Person
An Action
A Start Location
Players take it in turns with the first player putting down 2 cards:
A Disaster
A Destination
The other players then have to select a Person, Action and Start Location set of cards to create a story of how the Disaster happened at the Destination location.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Clam Island
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Characters have travelled to Clam Island to work for defenders of Justice. Main enemy is Bonecrusher pirates. Recommended for characters who want to fight against pirates. Defenders of Justice pays the reward only when Pirate captain "One eye" is delivered to Silverpearl. Promised reward is higher but there are no steady payments.

boardgame.name: Frostglade Tundra
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Frostglade Tundra is located on planet of Toril on continent of Faerûn. Frostglade Tundra is located in north-west part of Vaasa region between Tortured Land and Great Glacier.

boardgame.name: King Zadwer Balanescu
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Introductory adventure to the greatest bank heist in gnomish history! The Heist of the Mad King's Jewel!

The airship King Zadwer Balanescu is about to reach its destination, the industrious city of Moscopolis. The arrival will not go smoothly, however, as a group of militant revolutionaries calling themselves the Black Scarves takes most of the passengers and crew hostage and gains control of the ship. A group of adventurers finds themselves in this unenviable situation, with their goal being reaching the city in one piece. King Zadwer Balanescu is the free intro chapter of the upcoming, successfully kickstarted steampunk adventure for the 5th edition, The Heist of the Mad King’s Jewel. While this chapter is available for free, we appreciate any donations, which would go towards delivering a more polished final product.

boardgame.name: WW84: Wonder Woman Card Game
WW84: Wonder Woman â El Juego de Cartas
boardgame.description:
Based on the long-awaited movie Wonder Woman 1984, the fast-paced card game WW84: Wonder Woman 1984 Card Game lets up to four players take on the role of the Amazon princess as she fights off villains and saves innocent citizens.

In the game, you and all other players each have your own deck comprised of four types of actions cards: block, lasso, sprint, and punch. On a turn, you play one or more cards against one of the enemies in play, possibly start that fight or possibly adding to the efforts of another Wonder Woman. When that enemy has had the right combination of actions played against it, players receive rewards depending on what and how much they contributed to that victory. Rescued civilians are your reward, and whoever has rescued the most civilians after all ten enemies have been defeated wins.

Title: WW84: Wonder Woman Card Game Publisher: Cryptozoic Entertainment Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Fearless Creatures: Add Players Pack
boardgame.description:
An expansion pack for Fearless Creatures that adds support for playing games with 3 or 4 players.

Extra cards for herd animals from the base game (and other expansions), plus some cards that are unique to this pack.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Fearless Creatures: P is for Panda Pack
boardgame.description: An expansion pack for Fearless Creatures that mostly adds pandas (red panda, giant panda, brown panda, trash panda, panda ant), but also adds some new places and some new creatures.

boardgame.name: Last War: West
boardgame.description:
"Last war: West" is a Chinese board wargame based on the Cold War, simulated from middle to the end of the 20th century.

Players will play the role of the highest staff of the two camps in this game, command the troops of the countries they belong to, and simulate the confrontation between Warsaw Pact and NATO during the peak standoff of the Cold War.

This work is based on the division and brigade level. It focuses on combing firepower and combat processes, and introducing more reasonable and operational air force mechanisms to get rid of the "Cold War drived by World War II system" criticized by players. Through the gradual disclosure of military information in the past 30 years since the end of the Cold War in real world, we could restored the fight against both sides in If... history as realistically as possible.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Last War: West 1968/1989 â Expansion Pack

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: VindsjÃ¤l - Speltestregler
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Free playtest rules for the upcoming main core rulebook that is currently being crowdfunded. The playtest rules includes character generation.

boardgame.name: Pitcoin
boardgame.description:
Trade cards with between two and five other players to be the first to collect the entire set of one cryptocurrency. Inspired byt the classic game, Pit, trades are carried out blind and simultaneously with all players in this frantic party game.

Each cryptocurrency has a value and the first player to 500 wins. But be careful, because the value of each coin fluctuates and players can use the 'Crash the Market' card to boost the value of their holdings and destroy their opponents'.

Players can also use the 'Blockchain' card to temporarily halt trading and see what another player is holding in their hand.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: WheelVille
boardgame.description:
How would our little-big planet look like without us, its inhabitants?
And what happens here and now, when the responsibility for its well-being rests with us more than ever?
WheelVille is not just another board game. It has its own philosophy: when you take something from your environment, you need to replace it with an equally valuable thing. You need to regenerate.
Give it all you’ve got to realize the full potential of the small village of WheelVille. Don’t be a mere player; be an entrepreneur!
However, the resources at your disposal are not infinite. And this is the challenge of the game – maintaining the balance. Developing your business in harmony with nature’s well-being.
Play your part in the big game of saving our planet. Be inspired, contemplate, innovate!
Welcome to WheelVille!

boardgame.name: Party Bowl
boardgame.description:
Three rounds, two teams, and one Party Bowl! In this instant classic from What Do You Meme?, players use prompt cards to come up with a bunch of words or phrases which get thrown in the Party Bowl. Two teams then compete to out-guess each other in three increasingly high-pressure rounds of fun.

Family friendly: This game is part of What Do You Meme?®’s lineup of family-friendly games! Perfect for family game night, game night with friends, and gatherings of all kinds. Designed for ages 12+ to be as risqué (or not) as you like.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cthulhu: Death May Die â Black Goat of the Woods: Feldherr Storage Box
boardgame.description: Convenient flat cardboard box to safely store and transport the miniatures and accessories from the Cthulhu: Death May Die expansion
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Cthulhu: Death May Die â Black Goat of the Woods

boardgame.name: Coconut Pirate
boardgame.description:
Coconut Pirate is a visual agility game. Each player has a group of dices with sides of colors and different icons. Every player's turn it throws a dice and the first locating a combination of three dices with the same colour or icons claims it. If more than one combination found, claim it saying the number of combinations.

The fastest player gets the dices and moves its pirate token in the scoring path, the "Treasure map", the same number of steps as the combinations found. The first one to reach the top wins.

boardgame.name: Say What?!: The Adult Party Game!
boardgame.description:
Say What?! The Adult Party Game!

The adult party game about conjuring up clues about ridiculously disgusting cards with sneaky deceptions and challenging bids.

Contents: 250 cards, 150 betting chips and a bottle opener to mark the correct card.

Go from party zero, to party hero – and reap the rewards that come along with Party Champ status.

An unsavory, nauseating and unwholesome specimen of a card game. Not to be confused with a savory, uneasy and wholesome legume.


Each player gets 10 of the sick and twisted cards, enough voting cards as there are players, and 10 green chips.
On your go pick one of your cards and say a clue about the card. The clue can be anything like “This is something Dave would do.” or “If my wife caught me doing this then she would probably join in.” or “This card is like something from Jurassic Park.” or if you don’t have much imagination then you can just say “This is very painful.”. The clue shouldn’t be too obvious or too obscure so finding the perfect balance is crucial.
Place your card face down on the table. All other players then choose one card from their hand that closely matches the clue. All cards are placed face down on the table and shuffled together.
All cards are then dealt face up on the place holder cards which are lettered A-F (for up to 6 players).
Once all ridiculous cards have been read out it is then time for all other players to choose a letter card and bet some chips on which card you think the initial clue was about.
Once all players have placed their bets with the somewhat strange betting chips the original card is revealed by placing the bottle opener on it.
All players can now reveal which card they thought it was by turning over their letter card. The players that guessed the correct card win the same amount of chips that they bet.
The players that guessed incorrectly have to give all of their bet chips to the player who played the card that misdirected them.
The winner is the player with the most chips!

boardgame.name: The Round Up
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A herd of wild horses have been roaming the northern California and Oregon wastes. Loung Wang, a horse dealer in Barter Town, is looking for horse wranglers to rustle up this wild herd and bring them back to Barter Town for training and distribution. The Round Up is an Exodus OPS campaign scenario recommended for 4 to 6 characters of 5th to 7th level.

boardgame.name: The Package
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Postal Riders perform a valuable service in the wastes – transporting goods and letters to help link communities together. When a group of Riders are almost killed in the line of duty by a doomsday cult, a few good men are needed to get some rare holy books to their final destination. Can the party survive the cult’s fiery gauntlet? The Package is an Exodus OPS campaign scenario for 4 to 6 characters of 4th to 6th level.

boardgame.name: Gangster's Paradise
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Las Vegas is a working man’s town, with several attractions to catch the eye and to empty the pocket on The Vegas Strip. What thrills will you find in the city of sin? Gangsters Paradise is an Exodus OPS campaign scenario for 4 to 6 characters of 2nd to 6th level.

boardgame.name: Down in Old Mexico
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Deep in the deserts of Mexico lays a mysterious lost city. Rumors about this hidden place and its pre-Exodus secrets have spurred the interest of travelers and fortune seekers across known wastelands. A trip to the Junkyard leads to a quest into old Mexico in search of lost treasure. But are you prepared for terrifying secrets that waits beneath the sands. Down in Old Mexico is a 2-round continuous Exodus OPS campaign adventure for 4 to 6 characters of 5th to 7th levels.

boardgame.name: The Gathering
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Doc Brown of the Ghul Collective is researching the evolutionary effects of post-Exodus animals in the wasteland. He is in need of research volunteers to go into the Redwood forest to gather specimens for his studies and return with them to the Berkley research facility. The Gathering is an Exodus OPS campaign scenario for 4 to 6 characters of any character level.

boardgame.name: Texas Road Trip
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Techno-Reapers do not often travel into Texas, but a caravan full of precious gasoline is worth the risk, and worth hiring some extra guards. A lot can happen out in the Texas Wastes. Texas Road Trip is an Exodus OPS campaign scenario designed for 4 to 6 characters of 5th to 7th levels.

boardgame.name: OPS Wasteland Campaign Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This OPS guide is for convention play character gerenation rules for the Exodus Wasteland Adventures. This version (9-2014) replaces version (6-2010).

boardgame.name: Personality Flaws & Traits - Web Supplement
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This product is designed for use with any d20/OGL or Pathfinder systems and details over 60 personality flaws and traits to give character unique advantages or quirks at character creation.

boardgame.name: Exodus Texas
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Exodus Texas is a stand alone expansion for the Exodus Post Apocalyptic RPG. Texas details new character options (race, skills, feats, equipment, and advanced classes) and Texas organizations and major settlements.

boardgame.name: Exodus Post-Apocalyptic RPG Overseer's Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Exodus Overseer's Guide is the Game Master's Guide for running the Exodus Post-Apocalyptic RPG game. The rules within are designed to alter the Apocalyptic experience into a hoard of different Apocalyptic scenarios as well as teach how to be the Overseer. Many rules from the d20/Modern OGL document have been updated to fit into an apocalyptic setting along with new or expanded rules, and a hoard of examples for the Overseer to use. This product requires and works in conjunction with the Exodus Survivor's Guide. It is also recommended to have the Exodus Southwest Guide and Wasteland Bestiary, but is not necessary. This guide is fully compatible with other d20/OGL/Pathfinder products.

boardgame.name: Exodus Post-Apocalyptic Roleplaying Evolution System
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Evolution System is a d100 system that uses d6 and d10 dice. The system has two core mechanics that drive an attribute system and combat system. All other crafted mechanics are optional plugins to the core.

boardgame.name: King of Tokyo/King of New York: Ikarioh (promo character)
boardgame.description: æ©åç²åã¤ã«ãªãªã¼ (Mobile Armor Ikario) is one of the country specific promo monsters for King of Tokyo and King of New York. (Japan)

boardgame.name: Chevrons
boardgame.description:
2 players Red and Blue

A hexagonal board made up of triangles. A supply of Red chevrons and Blue chevrons and supply of Red and Blue cubes.

Play
Red moves first. Then turns alternate.

On a turn place a chevron in your color on the board along 2 edges that meet at 120 degrees. A chevron cannot be placed so that it is fully or partially inside of a previously enclosed area.

An area of empty cells encircled by edges of both colors counts for the player with the most edges bordering it. Once an area is encircled it is immediately claimed by placing a cube in a player's color within the area. This includes areas that are encircled simultaneously for either player.

The game ends when a player is unable to take his turn.

Scoring
Players count all the triangular cells within their claimed areas.

Open areas (areas not fully encircled) and areas encircled with an equal number of Blue and Red edges are not counted.

The player encircling the greater number of cells is the winner.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: The Delian Tomb
boardgame.description:
A First Level Adventure for First Time Players

From the introduction:

This adventure begins in a small hamlet in the backwater of the kingdom, it's a quiet place... most of the time.

Recently, there has been an in influx of goblins in the region and some of the foul creatures have even begun attacking the farms in the outskirts of the village of Villane.

The Player Characters are all friends from a nearby village, traveling to Bedegar, in search of adventure.

It isn't long before they find themselves mixed up in the business of Goblins, persuing the daughter of the Blacksmith into the depths of a long forgotten tomb.

This is their opportunity to prove themselves, and to rescue someone in need, if they can survive the perils of the Delian Tomb!

boardgame.name: House on the Fields
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

There is a house nearby that has been empty ever since the entire family- servants, children, and all- vanished. It has lain empty for twenty years, and it is said that all who go near it go mad. Normally, the house maintains its distance. The villagers don’t approach the house, and the house leaves the villagers alone.

However, recently, a darkness has been spreading from the house, and the people are fearful that the curse of the house will infect the village. The house itself if two miles out from the town, but you can see a vague dark shape atop the hill from the center of the village. A party of adventurers must go and explore the house, to try to stop the darkness there.

boardgame.name: 1,000 Year Beard: The Whisker Wizard
boardgame.description:
Advanced rules and cards for 1,000 Year Beard. Powerful new player cards allow for more fantastic beard-growing options. The new Pocket cards add varied boosted-actions and let Dwarfs hold an extra card!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Shadow Drow
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Step into a world free of political intrigue and scheming. Free from the battle between good and evil, or law and chaos. Take up a dagger and delve into the shadows to enter a world of secrecy with the Shadow Drow!

In this volume you will find:
• a full history and background of the secretive Shadow Drow
• full character traits to generate one of these fascinating Drow.
• 4 gods of neutrality that empower the shadows they live in
• 3 new class options: cleric – shade domain, fighter – dark warrior, and rogue – the shadow
• 3 new blade weapons and a powerful bow
• 10 new feats
• 9 new spells
• a fully fleshed out adventure location that is full of mystery
Dare you take up the call of the shadows? Only the strongest survive in this world.

boardgame.name: Cold War: Containment
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are still events going on in Tunguska…

Sometime in the late 1960s, the Soviet government, secretly in turmoil in the face of rapidly advancing American technology and global influence, desperately sought ways to even the score without triggering a nuclear conflict, but with devastating effects, nonetheless. Their chance came when reports of strange phenomena began filtering in from the vicinity of the 1908 Tunguska Event, in the wake of a severe electrical storm, of mysterious deaths and disappearances, strange creatures loose in the forests, and other weirdness. A team from the Soviet Academy of Sciences was sent to investigate. Less than 72 hours later, a garbled distress call prompted the mobilization of a special Red Army detachment and some of Russia’s top scientists from the State Committee of Science and Technology.

What the scientists found might thrust the Soviet Union into the forefront of all other countries…or make it the threshold of worldwide disaster. Meanwhile, scientists and soldiers alike struggle to keep the deadly secret of their discovery.

Cold War: Containment is a contemporary horror micro-campaign setting for 2D6 RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG).

boardgame.name: Archon
Liber Genus IV: Archon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever looked at a creature and thought, "hmm, that would be interesting to play"? Have you thought it a shame that some creatures look like you could walk down the street in your game as one yet there are no hard rules on how to do that? Well the Liber Genus series aims to fill that niche.

This fourth installment brings the lawful archons to the table, with rules on how to create a character as an ancestry. Incorporating 4 heritages focusing on their virtues such as justice and courage as well as 12 ancestry feats.

boardgame.name: Savage Avengers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore the Fury Archetype with a host of new options

The Fury is the archetype in Newtonium Engine that focuses on action and combat. They are masters of dominating their opponents both in combat and social situations with their speed, drive and skill.

This book provides a host of new options for the Fury archetype, including...

six new sub-archetypes,
twelve new talents and elemental powers,
four new rituals, and
a selection of example ways to use the skill action system to maximise your potential in combat

boardgame.name: Spitsfall Eyrie
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Who lives up here?

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A pair of 30 x 30 maps depicting an a rundown wizard's house on an island at the top of a waterfall. Interiors and underground hippogriff stables are included.
The map is presented in both summer and autumn versions.

boardgame.name: Spritefall Circle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A fey circle in a place of magic

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting a fey circle of standing stones, on an island near a waterfall. Includes a fairy cave.

boardgame.name: Old Spit Drop
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A blighted and dead river and waterfall

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting a blighted river and waterfall. A coven of witches meet in a cave beneath the ruin.

boardgame.name: Aelrift Overlook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A sinister watchtower in the Underdark
A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting a Drow stronghold or watchtower in the Underdark. Interiors and underground prison are included.

boardgame.name: The Time Gate
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Just ignore any risk to the space-time continuum...

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A pair of 30 x 30 maps depicting the a time machine facility, in both active and inactice forms.

boardgame.name: The Under Caves - The Hall of Sacrifice
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modular Kit: The Under Caves - Hall of Sacrifice is a printable dungeon tileset compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone set, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Modular Kit: The Under Caves - Hall of Sacrifice is a 20x30 battlemap depicting a large ceremonial chamber and temple in the Underdark. . The map works well on its own, but is even better with the Modular: Under Caves set.

boardgame.name: The Lord of the Forge Holds: The Hostage Treaty
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure shard for a party of level 7 to 9 heroes who oppose the undead.

The Lord of the Forge, a great Dwarven King, holds a dark artifact of great value - one of the phylacteries that keeps the Archlich known as "The Deathless One" alive.
But that phylactery is also the treaty that keeps undead hordes from assaulting the dwarven mines, so The Lord of the Forge is unlikely to give it up willingly.

This Adventure Shard details how an adventuring party might get hold of the Hostage Treaty, with both combat and skill-based Extended Challenges whether they use trickery or simply break into his vault.

The Extended Challenge rules-set is included alongside the Adventure Shard allowing you to make use of a new subsystem for deeper non-combat challenges.

boardgame.name: Undertards
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Abnormality Archives is a series of creature bestiary articles detailing new and unique monsters for your fantasy RPG games. System free and suitable for most generic FRPGs allowing the GM to stat out the creatures for your own game.

Keep a lookout for further instalments of this series of unusual beasts on a regular basis!


5 features the inbred and downright crazed race of the Undertards, dark dwelling mongrol humanoids to make trouble for your party!!

boardgame.name: Burials of Teganshire (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Staying alive…
…will be the least of your troubles.
The road through Tegan’s Bridge is not safe anymore.
The small village of Teganhsire is in disarray as the workers sent to repair the bridge never came back to town, and rumors spread that a monster has killed them all. Hired PCs investigate the situation but find themselves thrown into a maelstrom of druidic intrigue and repercussions of an old feud between the village and forest spirits.

Burials of Teganshire is a module for level 1-3 characters the DM can use in any campaign setting (commercial or homebrew). It is the first module of the Circle of the Blood Moon adventure path that will take characters to level 10, through a long campaign filled with complex encounters and ancient mysteries.

A Challenging Campaign Setting Agnostic, Modular Adventure
We wanted to put modular back into the module. The Kingdom of Lothmar is our setting, and in the appendix of the module, we guide how to play this adventure in Lothmar. However, we designed it so that if you want to play the module in your campaign world, you totally can. How do we achieve that? First off, the action of the module is local; it spans an area of about 15 miles wide, that you can easily plug into your preferred setting. Also, we made sure to strip any lore or NPC behavior that would not apply to most game worlds, offering the possibility to play it as it is, or DMs to add their custom lore-specific content to their liking.

Heroic Content for Heroic PCs
We want players to feel like heroes. Our modules are challenging and complex because players do not like to feel their progression is undeserved. Nothing beats a party of players cheering at each other after a tough battle. We also believe that actions should have consequences, and our modules include many different possible endings based on how the players behaved. Motivated and plausible NPCs support compelling stories. Every important NPC has motivations and perspectives, giving DMs the tools to bring the environment to life.

Stuffed with Amazing Maps and High-Quality Goodness!
First, the maps: We’re pretty proud of them and excited to put them in your hands. We humbly think we have the best maps in the industry!

This module comes with maps-you-can-play-with. Our maps are no mere fancy illustrations for the book; they are immersive tools for players and DMs to use. The maps presented in the module are of small enough scale that, again, you can plug them into your world. We think of maps as story generators: when characters need to travel from one locale to another, a rich and detailed map turns that journey into an adventure.

Kandra Full Page Map by Anna Meyer
Kandra Overland Zoom Map by Anna Meyer
Teganshire Village Battle Map by Daniel Hasenbos
Tegan’s Bridge Battle Map by Daniel Hasenbos
The Grotto DM Battle Map by Daniel Hasenbos
The Grotto VTT Battle Map by Daniel Hasenbos
Burials of Teganshire is 30 pages with an easy to use layout, printed on 70lb paper using a premium color printing technique. Included is a free 16-page PDF of the Viscounty of Kandra Gazetteer. Buy today; you won’t be disappointed!

boardgame.name: Aventuras de 1 PÃ¡gina: O Tesouro de BarbaRosa
The Treasure of Pinkbeard
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

1 page adventures is a serie of adventures to you adapt to any RPG system. A perfect plot to start a new campaing or to put in between of your adventures in the most different worlds!


Aventuras de 1 Página é uma séria para adaptar para em qualquer sistema. Um plot perfeito para começar a jogar ou colocar entre suas aventuras, nos mais diversos cenários e ambientações!

boardgame.name: Planar Companions
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Planar companions have an influence from the planes beyond the prime. Instead of choosing to have a savage or nimble advanced companion, you can instead choose a Planar advancement, such as a Alien, Ancestral or Entrophic companion.

Includes 17 advanced companion options and 19 companion specialisations, all relating to a planar influcence.

boardgame.name: Planar Lineages
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Although you are not truly a planar scion you have a hint of planar influence in your ancestry.

The following lineage ancestry feats can be selected by any ancentry whenever you have the option to gain a new ancestry feat. You can never have more than one lineage, you cannot train out of a lineage feat, but you can train into it, or select it as a new feat even when you are not 1st level, as the previously unknown hint in your ancestry manifests.

Each planar lineage feat grants you a trait, such as FIRE or GOOD. This treat is only applicable to meet prerequisites, such as the Planar Companion advancements.

boardgame.name: Dellerwood
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dellerwood is built in, around, and among the questing roots of the great hardwood trees of the deep forest. Peopled by beekeepers, woodcutters, hunters, and miners, the village is relatively prosperous—if for no other reason than there are several ruins deeper into the woods often visited by adventurers, who must stop in Dellerwood for supplies.

In the foothills a few miles away there is an excellent source of copper. Miners consume vast quantities of charcoal smelting the raw ore into ingots of raw copper they bring to Dellerwood and thence on to the city. It is said there would be not a single copper coin in circulation were it not for Dellerwood’s miners.

The village is most famous, however, for its bees. For generations, villagers have been known for honey, beeswax, and other bee-based products of the highest quality. Anyone coming near the village is first approached and inspected by a bee or two. The thing is these bees are as big as your leg!

boardgame.name: The Devil's Due
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

People disappear. Trade caravans fall prey to monsters, bandits, or natural disasters. Would-be mages push their understanding too far and are annihilated by forces they didn’t anticipate. Secret good fortune leads people to vanish into the night to seek greener pastures.

Some people, however, are stolen. Infants robbed from cribs, travelers lured off the path with tricks or gifts, lovers and agents are recruited, and terrible retribution is meted out for slights both great and small. For idle whim and deep passion alike they do this, but one obligation unites most faerie kingdoms: every seven years, Hell demands its tribute.

The Devil’s Due details the Hell Tithe and provides inspiration and tools for bringing it into your adventures in a variety of ways. It includes a discussion on the ways in which faeries go about stealing lives and numerous random tables to inspire ideas for your own campaign.

boardgame.name: Windswept Moors
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. Compiled from the free 20 Things posts available at Raging Swan’s website, this short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the windswept moors in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Iopos: Lair of Deceit
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

Our Beacon, Our Light, Our All

Founded by the tribal clans of the Iopa plain, the city of Iopos was long considered a minor power in Barsaive. Even after the Scourge, the city’s harsh justice and devotion to Uhl Denariastas was seen as strange, but not overtly dangerous. After all, the Long Night had many consequences.

But when a Denairastas agent assassinated King Varulus III of Throal, the true extent of the Iopan threat was revealed. The Holders of Trust has eyes and agents across Barsaive. Gathering information. Pitting neighbor against neighbor. Manipulating events to bring the province under Uhl’s control.

This sourcebook for Earthdawn dives into the enigmatic home of the Denairastas clan. Learn the history and customs of the people who live there. Explore the Ministries that control every aspect of public life. Uncover the secrets of the Holders of Trust and their nefarious masters.

You must know your enemy to defeat them. That knowledge can be found in Iopos: Lair of Deceit.

boardgame.name: Der KraftkÃ¶nig
boardgame.description:
The game pieces are black on one side and white on the other side. The starting player sets one piece with his color on top in the center space. This is the powerking (Kraftkönig). Then the players set alternately pieces of their color on the 8 spaces surrounding the powerking (satellites). Then the game spreads to the outer area. Each player may place a piece adjacent to an enemy piece, thereby enclosing a number of enemy pieces between two own pieces. The enclosed pieces (including, should the situation arise, the powerking and his satellites) are turned over to change their color. The game ends when all spaces are occupied.

The players are awarded points for any pieces of their color: 1 point for each piece in the outer area, 9 points for the powerking and 3 points for each of his satellites.

The player with the most points wins the game.

This game is a variant of "Reversi" and was released in booklet format in "Bunkerspiele Heft 2 - Spiele unter Kameraden" with the game board and cut-out game pieces in the back of the booklet.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Wizard's Test: Deadly Combat (Monsters! Monsters! Version)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Prove that you have what it takes to be an agent of the Death Goddess by taking the Wizard's Test that will challenge your wit and prowess in some very sticky situations indeed.

The Wizard's Test is a revised version of a 2011 solo with a different and more deadly rules set for combat. It has been optimized for Monsters! Monsters! 2d edition, and it's really an adventure for low level nonhuman characters. Profusely illustrated, and with large type to make it easy to read and play.

boardgame.name: Pax Lexque Campaign Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pax Lexque is a campaign setting based on an alternate reality historical earth in which the Roman Empire was co-mingled with conventional elements of fantasy - elves, dwarves, wizards, clerics, giants, dragons and everything else you’d expect.

After a magical war tore the Roman Empire apart, the empire is now rebuilding, with its eyes on its eternal motto, “Pax Lexque” or “Peace and Law”. The campaign's starter modules (The Hand of the Law) place PCs in a special forces arm of the imperial army. Their squad is sent on missions to deal with unexplained problems left over from the magical war - cursed or haunted battlefields, horrific monsters summoned during the war, necromancers and diabolists who still try to delve into forbidden knowledge.

This guide is meant as a sandbox environment. The world of the Great Sea region is presented with its history and geography broken down to twenty nations, ready for characters to explore. Nineteen new patrons particular to this world are described, six of which are presented in full detail, complete with patron spells. Also included are four new character classes: Dwarven Cleric, Elven Ranger, Felid (or catfolk) and Gnome.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Isles of the Celts
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Isles of the Celts is an expansion of the campaign world presented in the Pax Lexque Campaign Guide. It can be used in conjunction with the Pax Lexque Campaign Guide or it may stand on its own.

This guide is meant as a sandbox environment. In this world, the Roman incursion into Britain was unsuccessful, leaving Britain under Celtic control. The world of the Celtic isles is presented with its legends and geography broken down to fourteen kingdoms, ready for characters to explore. Ten new patrons particular to this setting are described, five of which are given in full detail, complete with patron spells. Several new classes are presented: Bard, Druid, Fey-touched and Witch.

Also given detailed attention herein are the magical races of the fey. Some are helpful, some mischievous and some sinister, but they all are enigmatic from the point of view of other beings. The seelie and unseelie courts are detailed as well as twenty one different types of fey
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Hyrule Warriors: Age of Calamity
boardgame.description: Introducing Hyrule Warriors: Age of Calamity, a new story set 100 years before The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild. Battle as legendary warriors and experience the emotional events of the Great Calamity first-hand.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 Famitsu Awards Best Action Game of the Year Nominee
2020 NAVGTR Award Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
